headline: Media analysis of President Bidenâ€™s CNN town hall

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: So, thanks to CNN, we learned a lot of new things about President Biden, A, he likes to build a fire in the Oval Office. B, he uses the fireplace. C, he often throws a log on otherwise known as a John Kerry. D, he likes to read the newspaper on a plane.   This is some crazy [bleep]. So what else will we hope to learn from our fearless press? That Joe puts his socks on one foot at a time, hopefully before he puts on his slippers?  But in all seriousness, this is a great strategy. The more boring Joe appears, the easier it is to slip in those radical policies. It's truly the opposite of Trump who commanded everyone's attention so he was always scrutinized.  But Joe, he just Joes along and the media just smiles and returns to their needlepoint. Next thing you know, you've got the expansion of the welfare state and trillions of dollars for cockamamie climate plans. Yes, I said cockamamie, bleep me.    But hey, everyone knows Joe likes kids better than people.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN (D), PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: Everybody knows I like kids better than people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because as you know, kids aren't people. Meanwhile, The Lincoln Project says, you love kids more than people, hold my Capri Sun.  But I guess we did learn one thing after all, Joe still makes no damn sense. We saw that on Tuesday when CNN went to town with Grandpa Joe. Tell us Joe, was there nothing in the refrigerator?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: There was nothing in the refrigerator figuratively and literally speaking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tell us more, Joe, about the grandchildren can use that online you know --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: You know, my grandchildren can use that -- that online, you know, make me look like I'm, you know, in the seventh century.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How folksy. He is like Bill Cosby without the sweaters or the roofies. But finally China did come up in the conversation, giving Joe an opportunity to condemn their treatment of the Uighurs.    I wonder if culturally there are different norms that each country and their leaders are expected to follow.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Culturally, there are different norms in each country and their leaders are expected to follow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Talk about true diversity, systemic torture, concentration camps. Yes, that sounds weird to our American ears, but I'm sure we do stuff that seems weird to them, like not having systemic torture and concentration camps. But it's strange that Joe makes excuses for that stuff when only weeks ago, he called our immigration policies inexcusable. Why is that? Is it because it's easy? Because China's atrocities are balanced out by affordable basketball shoes?   Maybe it's me, but this China First America Last shtick is already getting kind of old.   And what of poor Press Secretary Jen Psaki, who said that schools could reopen if they hold only one day of in-person learning a week. Joe wouldn't dare throw her under the bus and call it a mistake in communication.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: That was a mistake in the communication. The goal will be five days a week. Now it's going to be harder to open up the high schools.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Poor Jen, she only missed it by four days.  But I guess this is all part of the processes.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: It looks like there was a conflation of two ongoing processes, one that's through the courts and one that is through the CFIUS process that goes through the Department of Treasury. There is a rigorous CFIUS process that is ongoing. I'm not going of course, not that you're expecting me to set a precedent of commenting on those reviews in process, but would just stress that they are distinct processes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a lot of processes. I wonder if that's your new favorite phrase.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay, $3.75, will that be cash or credit?

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR, IMPERSONATING JEN PSAKI
utterances.sentences: Well, it's interesting, right? Because processing each of those processes is a different process of processes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Right? Well, the process here is you give me $3.75.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to set a precedent of commenting on those processes, except to say that they are two distinct processes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I woke up this morning, my coffee pot, not working. Oh, I have to ask you, my brother's getting married in a month or so, and I wanted to take the day off, what's the process for that?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Oh, I'm so glad you brought up the process, because it's very important in any process for the processor --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I was just supposed to --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Sorry, please don't interrupt the process of processing those processes. I've got to call you back. My husband's on the phone. Hello.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Honey, oh my God, the roof is leaking. I got water flooding into the house. I need the number for the roofer right now.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Well, as I said before, President Biden does take climate change very seriously. That's why we have rejoined the Paris Climate Accords.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No, you don't understand the water is pouring into the house right now.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I understand that there is a flooding process that is ongoing. I am processing that. I really think you just need to calm down and trust the processes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I guess you needed something to replace circling back. Of course, after Joe stumbled through the Town Hall, how did the media respond? Hmm, this sounds like a segue for a new thing we're calling --

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Fawn Stars.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know, the thing about Joe Biden is that he speaks in very human terms.

utterances.speaker: DAVID AXELROD, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: The thing about Joe Biden is he speaks in very human terms. And you know, these Town Halls are sort of, if he were an Olympian, this would be his gold medal event.

utterances.speaker: NIA-MALIKA HENDERSON, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL REPORTER
utterances.sentences: And classic Joe Biden, this is a forum that he has shined in because he's just a man of fundamental human decency.

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Can you just weigh in, finally, Jim, on the humility? I mean, when he talked at the end of the town hall about like, I wake up in the White House, and I ask Jill, where are we? And I'm uncomfortable with them putting my suit jacket on and having all this help? I mean, what a -- what a breath of fresh air.

utterances.speaker: JIM MESSINA, CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, MESSINA GROUP
utterances.sentences: Boy, it is true, Poppy, I teared up at that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He actually cried over that Town Hall. Don't let that wimp near the Hallmark Channel. He will explode. But they're like kids excited over mom's new boyfriend. The other one was such a jerk. But this guy, he won't make you work too hard or say mean stuff to your face. But you get the point, as long as Joe speaks in human terms, he can lie about the vaccine, lie about the minimum wage and write off Hong Kong and the Uighurs as a mere difference in cultural priorities. It's almost like Joe could say anything these days and get away with it. Right, Joe?

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: And now President Biden on his daily routine.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NATION HOST, IMPERSONATING JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I like a lot of things, didn't you read about it? I like fireplaces. I like sunsets. If you like pina coladas getting caught in the rain, I'm your man.  I'm not into health food. I am into champagne. If you like making love at midnight on the dunes of the cape, knock it off. You'll get VD. What's that? Sorry. COVID. Summon the troops.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nicely done. So it wasn't a great week for Joe, but it's hard to notice when no one really reports on it. As Joe brushes aside serious issues while enjoying the simple things of life like clouds and cottage cheese, the press will be there cataloging every moment and each one special moment will be the greatest thing since sliced bread. Yes, sliced bread. Joe really likes sliced bread. He thinks he invented it. There's your next story CNN, I bet Chris Cuomo will report that hell out of it.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guest. He is so gorgeous, his dimples have abs and his abs have dimples. "FOX and Friends" Weekend co-host and host of "Untold Patriots Revealed." What a title, premiering Monday on FOX Nation, Pete Hegseth. Well, she is so bright, chandeliers send her hate mail. FOX News Headlines 24/7 reporter, Carley Shimkus. And she is so sharp a bed of nails sleeps on her, host of "Sincerely, Kat" on FOX Nation, Kat Timpf. And the only thing bigger than his biceps is his heart. My massive sidekick and host of "Nuff Said" on FOX Nation, Tyrus. Yes, I turned it around. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That was so sweet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was sweet, you know, because I missed him on Valentine's Day. So you know, I thought I would open that. You want me to go to you first, Tyrus, Do you agree that Joe Biden is the sneakiest old white man on the planet?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Is he -- I mean, naturally when -- I'm glad you came to me as an expert. I've been studying old white men for about five years right now. I've come to some observation. They are all clever tricksters. And when they don't know, they really know. And I think what's happening right now is Joe is having a bit of fun of us. He can fall asleep in a meeting. He can say whatever he wants, and we all say oh, it's so cute.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It's great. Forget the fact that he is the President of the United States and maybe, you should know, saying like the refrigerator was full or not full or what have you and saying things like, my kids know that internet. The internet is not a person, place or thing. It's -- is it a thing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know what it is.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Is it a thing?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It's a way of life.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I confuse myself. I'm still caught up in the whole processes -- you get dumbed down by the dumbness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's infectious.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It will get you -- we are all dumber.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's infectious. The way, Pete, the way Trump made us all like Trumpy, Biden is making this all Bideny.

utterances.speaker: PETE HEGSETH, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: Bideny -- I am surprised the one clip you didn't play was him wandering around with Jill, maybe you used it last week with all the hearts on Valentine's Day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I cried.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: It was brilliant, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I was like that dude.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: In sort of --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I wept.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: You wept?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. What did you make of the Town Hall?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Jesus wept is my favorite verse in the Bible, the shortest one also.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: What did I make of the Town Hall? Lowest hanging fruit possible, softball questions, very easy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: And even the positive accounts of the Town Hall said, Joe Biden, who gave up often meandering answers.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Like they couldn't -- they can't say negative things. They just have to say, sometimes a little long-winded and a little meandering, sort of lost, you know, where am I? They'll never admit that. They'll cover for him completely, and we're all used to it. We know -- we're sedated for the next four years. We know that's exactly what we're getting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Carley, I bet you like the day-to-day info. CARLEY SHIMKUS, FOX NEWS HEADLINES 24/7 REPORTER: Well, you know, to be honest, I do like to learn little details about important people. But I think the thing that made this particular CNN article about the fireplace and the bed time and the Valentine's Day greeting that Jill Biden wrote near a window sill in the West Wing in 2009, all those little -- they are a little nauseating. It is because the media is so bias, you can see the political perspective and, you know, President -- former President Trump and the media were like oil and water, but even when he tried to do good things, they would criticize him. Like during the partial government shutdown when I think it was Clemson won the National Championship, and he had them over and then he had fast food kept in. There were some articles that called that racist and classist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It was grandfather-ish.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: I thought it was a very nice thing. It was fun and if you ask any of those players, they loved it.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: They loved it. Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: But you brought up a very good point in the intro when you said you have to watch out, because when the media stops taking politics, when they stop reporting on politicians seriously, politicians start feeling like they can get away with things. Look at what's going on with Andrew Cuomo right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I stole that point from Kennedy. You know, Kat, it's true. You know, the more boring big government becomes, and the more dangerous it is because you just stop caring.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely. I think a great example too is remember, everyone was lauding that beautiful moment when he was being so nice and sweet to the child that asked that question, saying, oh it's very rare for kids to get really sick with coronavirus. They don't really -- Everyone was like, well, beautiful, but when Trump said those things like he is spreading lies and misinformation. How dare he say -- it's like nobody -- I never heard anybody say that. I never heard anyone brought that up. It is like always so not -- but if you just took the exact same text, exact same words and had Trump say that it would have been a wall to wall scandal all day on these networks.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: And look what's going on in schools? You play that and then, look schools are still --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Why are they not -- nobody pressed him.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: There's never that connection.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Then why aren't the schools open then, Joe? Nobody even thought about how little sense that makes because they are already just looking at through this lens of this is the best guy ever. Look at him in his wife and how cute they are. I do not care. This is crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It sounds like a cliche, but you could do a whole TV show every week called "What if it were Trump?" Just like you could just show this thing what if it were Trump? You know, making no sense at all, saying that there were no vaccines, you know, lying about the minimum wage inflated numbers. It's crazy. All right, we've got to go. Also giving China a pass. All right, Cuomo's mess just keeps getting messier.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You can put a fork in New York. This week, New York Mayor Bill de Blasio announced he is bringing live performances back to the city as part of something called Open Culture Program as restaurants go out of business and crime soars. Here's the mayor's priority announcement.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR BILL DE BLASIO (D), NEW YORK CITY
utterances.sentences: We need a recovery that brings back the life and the heart and the energy of the city and that everyone gets to be a part of and we're going to do that. We're going to really bring back the heart and soul in New York City. We need arts and culture back and we need people to see it and feel it to participate in it. Our cultural communities, our conscience, our cultural community is our hope and our identity as New Yorkers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, you're telling me the pandemic is keeping that off the street? You think maybe we're giving the pandemic a bad rap? I joke. It's terrible that pandemic. But you know who deserves his bad rap? Yes, this fella. The F.B.I. has opened an investigation into Governor Cuomo is covering up nursing home COVID deaths. And this week New York State Assemblyman Ron Kim says Cuomo threatened to quote "destroy him" if he didn't help Cuomo contain the damage. But who needs fellow Dems when CNN has got your back? The network says they've reinstated a ban on Chris Cuomo covering his brother, the Governor. Funny they didn't do that when it was good news coming out of bad Andy. Anyway, here's a better choice for the Governor of New York.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I never -- Pete, I never get tired of looking at that. I've had that video on 24/7 since 2009. I don't know why.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: That's normal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What would you like to comment on? De Blasio's magical video? Cuomo or the fact that Cuomo is giving cover to de Blasio who is terrible but because Cuomo is worse, de Blasio is getting away with it?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: De Blasio is a Marxist socialist who has crushed New York City, yet somehow Cuomo walked into this. It is the arrogance of Cuomo that got him, right, writing a book in the middle of it. I've set the example. Oh my goodness, made a huge mistake ordering these people in. Now, I've got a cover up because there's an investigation. It's coming for him and now if you've got Comrade Cortez on top of it, it's even worse, but that video --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: You too can dance in the middle of the street. Surrounded by snow piles with masks on and that is how we will recapture New York.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I thought the video was crazy, it is like, I agree, New York is missing our arts and our cultures but that video does not represent art. That video is like what I look like after I leave the bar after having five tequila sodas, which I also miss to be able to do.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what that is, though? It's a reminder that the only people who appreciate that kind of dance are the type of people who engage in that kind of dance. Right? That is a -- that's kind of more of the internal community, not the external audience. That's about -- he is like almost talking to the dancers and not to the people who watch it.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: I think -- I'm sure that's really hard to do. I mean, they're much more limber than I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think you could it.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: They did it all together. They didn't all together.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Yes, you could do it.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: Thank you for thinking that.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I said Tyrus not Carley.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: Do you think I could do it? No. But I think -- I think it's just the music behind it and the fact that de Blasio could make anything less cool.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true. That's true.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: Like his voice set to the -- it was bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's like -- he is basically, you don't want Lurch endorsing any of your stuff. Tyrus, I am -- the CNN thing. Banning Chris from interviewing his brother has got to be one of the most idiotic stories of all. They milked that sibling rivalry for so long talking about his dating habits. And now when all [bleep] hits the fan.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, let's get after it. No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's not get after it.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Let's not get after it. Because are you saying that he is not fair and impartial?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: True.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Because he is described as an anchorman, so would it really matter?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's the thing.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Would it really matter as an anchor, if it's your -- you would know if he is lying faster because of your relationship, but you believe you'd say, I mean, you'd be proving a point as a strong journalist, that even though those guy's family, I'm going to get to the truth. And the truth is, so how's you're dating life? Like, why don't you come home for dinner? Why does mom get to live with you? Like, that's not what the American people want. I mean, that's basically the gist of their conversation. But if I could just -- and I don't know if you guys are aware of this, but in 2014, I won a Slammy in the WWE for dancer of the year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I did not know.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: We have a floor. Hello?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It was the whole -- no, I'm retired from dancing. But here's the thing, that type of dancing is very popular with a certain sect in our community, a cultural group, my six-year-old daughter and her friends and my nine-year-old, they all dance and clean around the house and one -- and do moves and I have to like carry on like I've done many interviews, while I have dancing in the background while they're doing moves.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And they're showing their stuff. They even tried to say, "Dad were dance fighting," and I sent them to their rooms because I'm not -- there is no such thing as dance fighting. Because it doesn't really happen. You can do all the pop, locks and flip. It's a punch. But that's the world we live in now, its fantasy world for little kids times, because dancing makes it all better. If you watch any new kid show, it was like there's this big issue between the pony and the unicorn, but somehow --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's solved?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Solve with a dance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, it's just like "West Side Story."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I solve everything by dancing, Pete.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: That's smart. I've seen "Stepbrothers." I see a microphone. I see a singer, I see a drum set. I see a drummer, I see a Slammy winter and I see a dance floor right here.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: And I think Tyrus, now, is your time.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, but all you need to see is seven figures, and I am in it.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Bring New York City back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. All right. All right. I'm still -- the take home message here is that de Blasio is factually worse than Cuomo. But Cuomo has made a national debacle.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It is bad that we're here in New York saying, yes, well, this one is -- they are both really awful.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But that guy ran for President and he is destroying the city, but we're so focused on Cuomo because of what he's done. It's like -- it is not fair.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Two bad things should have happened separately. I don't even know if that makes sense.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: It doesn't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It doesn't. Up next, we unveil our first heroes in media.

utterances.speaker: ASHLEY STROHMIER, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Ashley Strohmier. A terrifying close call for a Colorado suburb after a Hawaii-bound United Airlines flight experienced engine failure. The plane scattered debris including large metal parts across several neighborhoods in Broomfield. It landed safely at Denver International Airport. No injuries were reported, but some property damage was happening and anyone finding debris from the plane is advised not to move it or touch it. Federal investigators are on the scene. Also three people are dead and two others are hurt after a shooting at a New Orleans area gun store. Investigators said gunfire erupted after an argument between the suspect and an employee. The suspect who died at the scene reportedly entered the store with a fully loaded un-holstered gun. The two injured people were taken to the hospital and are stable. I'm Ashley Strohmier. Now back to THE GREG GUTFELD SHOW. For all your headlines log on to foxnews.com.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: In a profession full of zeros, it's time to note the heroes in a new segment we're calling --

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Heroes in media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Our first hero, MSNBC's Joe Scarborough on the left there, slamming the idiots on cable news channels for comparing the destruction at the Capitol in January to the destruction from riots over the summer.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: Because I know there are idiots on other cable news channels that will say, well, you know, this mom and pop store was vandalized during the summer riots and that's just as bad as the United States Capitol being vandalized. No, no, actually, no. No, jackass, it's not. I'm not going to confuse a taco stand with the United States Capitol. I'm not going to confuse the selling of tacos with actually moving through a constitutional process.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The selling of tacos. What a tomato face turd whistle. The truth is, of course, the riots resulted in more than 20 deaths, as well as property damage estimated into the billions making it the most expensive period of unrest in our nation's recorded history. That's some taco stand, you sunbaked whitehead. I think I could speak for Planet Earth when I say [bleep] you Joe Scarborough. Our runner up, Nicolle Wallace moaning in delight over a Trump casino implosion.

utterances.speaker: NICOLLE WALLACE, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: And I feel a little -- well, I don't feel bad playing it. Let me play this. This is the implosion of a Trump property. There it goes. Set a metaphor, Tim, are we done? This is Trump -- this is Trump and we've already ushered in -- are we done? Is it imploding?

utterances.utterance: Because as you know, kids aren't people. Meanwhile, The Lincoln Project says, you love kids more than people, hold my Capri Sun. But I guess we did learn one thing after all, Joe still makes no damn sense. We saw that on Tuesday when CNN went to town with Grandpa Joe. Tell us Joe, was there nothing in the refrigerator?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: There was nothing in the refrigerator figuratively and literally speaking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tell us more, Joe, about the grandchildren can use that online you know --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: You know, my grandchildren can use that -- that online, you know, make me look like I'm, you know, in the seventh century.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How folksy. He is like Bill Cosby without the sweaters or the roofies. But finally China did come up in the conversation, giving Joe an opportunity to condemn their treatment of the Uighurs. I wonder if culturally there are different norms that each country and their leaders are expected to follow.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: Culturally, there are different norms in each country and their leaders are expected to follow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Talk about true diversity, systemic torture, concentration camps. Yes, that sounds weird to our American ears, but I'm sure we do stuff that seems weird to them, like not having systemic torture and concentration camps. But it's strange that Joe makes excuses for that stuff when only weeks ago, he called our immigration policies inexcusable. Why is that? Is it because it's easy? Because China's atrocities are balanced out by affordable basketball shoes? Maybe it's me, but this China First America Last shtick is already getting kind of old. And what of poor Press Secretary Jen Psaki, who said that schools could reopen if they hold only one day of in-person learning a week. Joe wouldn't dare throw her under the bus and call it a mistake in communication.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: That was a mistake in the communication. The goal will be five days a week. Now it's going to be harder to open up the high schools.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Poor Jen, she only missed it by four days. But I guess this is all part of the processes.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: It looks like there was a conflation of two ongoing processes, one that's through the courts and one that is through the CFIUS process that goes through the Department of Treasury. There is a rigorous CFIUS process that is ongoing. I'm not going of course, not that you're expecting me to set a precedent of commenting on those reviews in process, but would just stress that they are distinct processes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a lot of processes. I wonder if that's your new favorite phrase.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Okay, $3.75, will that be cash or credit?

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR, IMPERSONATING JEN PSAKI
utterances.utterance: Well, it's interesting, right? Because processing each of those processes is a different process of processes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Right? Well, the process here is you give me $3.75.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to set a precedent of commenting on those processes, except to say that they are two distinct processes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I woke up this morning, my coffee pot, not working. Oh, I have to ask you, my brother's getting married in a month or so, and I wanted to take the day off, what's the process for that?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Oh, I'm so glad you brought up the process, because it's very important in any process for the processor --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Well, I was just supposed to --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Sorry, please don't interrupt the process of processing those processes. I've got to call you back. My husband's on the phone. Hello.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Honey, oh my God, the roof is leaking. I got water flooding into the house. I need the number for the roofer right now.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Well, as I said before, President Biden does take climate change very seriously. That's why we have rejoined the Paris Climate Accords.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: No, you don't understand the water is pouring into the house right now.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I understand that there is a flooding process that is ongoing. I am processing that. I really think you just need to calm down and trust the processes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Oh, God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I guess you needed something to replace circling back. Of course, after Joe stumbled through the Town Hall, how did the media respond? Hmm, this sounds like a segue for a new thing we're calling --

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Fawn Stars.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. You know, the thing about Joe Biden is that he speaks in very human terms.

utterances.speaker: DAVID AXELROD, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.utterance: The thing about Joe Biden is he speaks in very human terms. And you know, these Town Halls are sort of, if he were an Olympian, this would be his gold medal event.

utterances.speaker: NIA-MALIKA HENDERSON, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL REPORTER
utterances.utterance: And classic Joe Biden, this is a forum that he has shined in because he's just a man of fundamental human decency.

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: Can you just weigh in, finally, Jim, on the humility? I mean, when he talked at the end of the town hall about like, I wake up in the White House, and I ask Jill, where are we? And I'm uncomfortable with them putting my suit jacket on and having all this help? I mean, what a -- what a breath of fresh air.

utterances.speaker: JIM MESSINA, CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, MESSINA GROUP
utterances.utterance: Boy, it is true, Poppy, I teared up at that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He actually cried over that Town Hall. Don't let that wimp near the Hallmark Channel. He will explode. But they're like kids excited over mom's new boyfriend. The other one was such a jerk. But this guy, he won't make you work too hard or say mean stuff to your face. But you get the point, as long as Joe speaks in human terms, he can lie about the vaccine, lie about the minimum wage and write off Hong Kong and the Uighurs as a mere difference in cultural priorities. It's almost like Joe could say anything these days and get away with it. Right, Joe?

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: And now President Biden on his daily routine.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NATION HOST, IMPERSONATING JOE BIDEN
utterances.utterance: I like a lot of things, didn't you read about it? I like fireplaces. I like sunsets. If you like pina coladas getting caught in the rain, I'm your man. I'm not into health food. I am into champagne. If you like making love at midnight on the dunes of the cape, knock it off. You'll get VD. What's that? Sorry. COVID. Summon the troops.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nicely done. So it wasn't a great week for Joe, but it's hard to notice when no one really reports on it. As Joe brushes aside serious issues while enjoying the simple things of life like clouds and cottage cheese, the press will be there cataloging every moment and each one special moment will be the greatest thing since sliced bread. Yes, sliced bread. Joe really likes sliced bread. He thinks he invented it. There's your next story CNN, I bet Chris Cuomo will report that hell out of it.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's welcome tonight's guest. He is so gorgeous, his dimples have abs and his abs have dimples. "FOX and Friends" Weekend co-host and host of "Untold Patriots Revealed." What a title, premiering Monday on FOX Nation, Pete Hegseth. Well, she is so bright, chandeliers send her hate mail. FOX News Headlines 24/7 reporter, Carley Shimkus. And she is so sharp a bed of nails sleeps on her, host of "Sincerely, Kat" on FOX Nation, Kat Timpf. And the only thing bigger than his biceps is his heart. My massive sidekick and host of "Nuff Said" on FOX Nation, Tyrus. Yes, I turned it around. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That was so sweet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was sweet, you know, because I missed him on Valentine's Day. So you know, I thought I would open that. You want me to go to you first, Tyrus, Do you agree that Joe Biden is the sneakiest old white man on the planet?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Is he -- I mean, naturally when -- I'm glad you came to me as an expert. I've been studying old white men for about five years right now. I've come to some observation. They are all clever tricksters. And when they don't know, they really know. And I think what's happening right now is Joe is having a bit of fun of us. He can fall asleep in a meeting. He can say whatever he wants, and we all say oh, it's so cute.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's great. Forget the fact that he is the President of the United States and maybe, you should know, saying like the refrigerator was full or not full or what have you and saying things like, my kids know that internet. The internet is not a person, place or thing. It's -- is it a thing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know what it is.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Is it a thing?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It's a way of life.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I confuse myself. I'm still caught up in the whole processes -- you get dumbed down by the dumbness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's infectious.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It will get you -- we are all dumber.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's infectious. The way, Pete, the way Trump made us all like Trumpy, Biden is making this all Bideny.

utterances.speaker: PETE HEGSETH, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.utterance: Bideny -- I am surprised the one clip you didn't play was him wandering around with Jill, maybe you used it last week with all the hearts on Valentine's Day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I cried.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: It was brilliant, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was like that dude.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: In sort of --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wept.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You wept?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. What did you make of the Town Hall?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Jesus wept is my favorite verse in the Bible, the shortest one also.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: What did I make of the Town Hall? Lowest hanging fruit possible, softball questions, very easy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And even the positive accounts of the Town Hall said, Joe Biden, who gave up often meandering answers.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Like they couldn't -- they can't say negative things. They just have to say, sometimes a little long-winded and a little meandering, sort of lost, you know, where am I? They'll never admit that. They'll cover for him completely, and we're all used to it. We know -- we're sedated for the next four years. We know that's exactly what we're getting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Carley, I bet you like the day-to-day info. CARLEY SHIMKUS, FOX NEWS HEADLINES 24/7 REPORTER: Well, you know, to be honest, I do like to learn little details about important people. But I think the thing that made this particular CNN article about the fireplace and the bed time and the Valentine's Day greeting that Jill Biden wrote near a window sill in the West Wing in 2009, all those little -- they are a little nauseating. It is because the media is so bias, you can see the political perspective and, you know, President -- former President Trump and the media were like oil and water, but even when he tried to do good things, they would criticize him. Like during the partial government shutdown when I think it was Clemson won the National Championship, and he had them over and then he had fast food kept in. There were some articles that called that racist and classist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It was grandfather-ish.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: I thought it was a very nice thing. It was fun and if you ask any of those players, they loved it.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: They loved it. Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: But you brought up a very good point in the intro when you said you have to watch out, because when the media stops taking politics, when they stop reporting on politicians seriously, politicians start feeling like they can get away with things. Look at what's going on with Andrew Cuomo right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I stole that point from Kennedy. You know, Kat, it's true. You know, the more boring big government becomes, and the more dangerous it is because you just stop caring.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, absolutely. I think a great example too is remember, everyone was lauding that beautiful moment when he was being so nice and sweet to the child that asked that question, saying, oh it's very rare for kids to get really sick with coronavirus. They don't really -- Everyone was like, well, beautiful, but when Trump said those things like he is spreading lies and misinformation. How dare he say -- it's like nobody -- I never heard anybody say that. I never heard anyone brought that up. It is like always so not -- but if you just took the exact same text, exact same words and had Trump say that it would have been a wall to wall scandal all day on these networks.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: And look what's going on in schools? You play that and then, look schools are still --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Why are they not -- nobody pressed him.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: There's never that connection.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Then why aren't the schools open then, Joe? Nobody even thought about how little sense that makes because they are already just looking at through this lens of this is the best guy ever. Look at him in his wife and how cute they are. I do not care. This is crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It sounds like a cliche, but you could do a whole TV show every week called "What if it were Trump?" Just like you could just show this thing what if it were Trump? You know, making no sense at all, saying that there were no vaccines, you know, lying about the minimum wage inflated numbers. It's crazy. All right, we've got to go. Also giving China a pass. All right, Cuomo's mess just keeps getting messier.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can put a fork in New York. This week, New York Mayor Bill de Blasio announced he is bringing live performances back to the city as part of something called Open Culture Program as restaurants go out of business and crime soars. Here's the mayor's priority announcement.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR BILL DE BLASIO (D), NEW YORK CITY
utterances.utterance: We need a recovery that brings back the life and the heart and the energy of the city and that everyone gets to be a part of and we're going to do that. We're going to really bring back the heart and soul in New York City. We need arts and culture back and we need people to see it and feel it to participate in it. Our cultural communities, our conscience, our cultural community is our hope and our identity as New Yorkers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, you're telling me the pandemic is keeping that off the street? You think maybe we're giving the pandemic a bad rap? I joke. It's terrible that pandemic. But you know who deserves his bad rap? Yes, this fella. The F.B.I. has opened an investigation into Governor Cuomo is covering up nursing home COVID deaths. And this week New York State Assemblyman Ron Kim says Cuomo threatened to quote "destroy him" if he didn't help Cuomo contain the damage. But who needs fellow Dems when CNN has got your back? The network says they've reinstated a ban on Chris Cuomo covering his brother, the Governor. Funny they didn't do that when it was good news coming out of bad Andy. Anyway, here's a better choice for the Governor of New York.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I never -- Pete, I never get tired of looking at that. I've had that video on 24/7 since 2009. I don't know why.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That's normal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What would you like to comment on? De Blasio's magical video? Cuomo or the fact that Cuomo is giving cover to de Blasio who is terrible but because Cuomo is worse, de Blasio is getting away with it?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: De Blasio is a Marxist socialist who has crushed New York City, yet somehow Cuomo walked into this. It is the arrogance of Cuomo that got him, right, writing a book in the middle of it. I've set the example. Oh my goodness, made a huge mistake ordering these people in. Now, I've got a cover up because there's an investigation. It's coming for him and now if you've got Comrade Cortez on top of it, it's even worse, but that video --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You too can dance in the middle of the street. Surrounded by snow piles with masks on and that is how we will recapture New York.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I thought the video was crazy, it is like, I agree, New York is missing our arts and our cultures but that video does not represent art. That video is like what I look like after I leave the bar after having five tequila sodas, which I also miss to be able to do.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what that is, though? It's a reminder that the only people who appreciate that kind of dance are the type of people who engage in that kind of dance. Right? That is a -- that's kind of more of the internal community, not the external audience. That's about -- he is like almost talking to the dancers and not to the people who watch it.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: I think -- I'm sure that's really hard to do. I mean, they're much more limber than I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think you could it.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: They did it all together. They didn't all together.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Yes, you could do it.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: Thank you for thinking that.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I said Tyrus not Carley.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: Do you think I could do it? No. But I think -- I think it's just the music behind it and the fact that de Blasio could make anything less cool.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true. That's true.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: Like his voice set to the -- it was bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's like -- he is basically, you don't want Lurch endorsing any of your stuff. Tyrus, I am -- the CNN thing. Banning Chris from interviewing his brother has got to be one of the most idiotic stories of all. They milked that sibling rivalry for so long talking about his dating habits. And now when all [bleep] hits the fan.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, let's get after it. No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's not get after it.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Let's not get after it. Because are you saying that he is not fair and impartial?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Because he is described as an anchorman, so would it really matter?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's the thing.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Would it really matter as an anchor, if it's your -- you would know if he is lying faster because of your relationship, but you believe you'd say, I mean, you'd be proving a point as a strong journalist, that even though those guy's family, I'm going to get to the truth. And the truth is, so how's you're dating life? Like, why don't you come home for dinner? Why does mom get to live with you? Like, that's not what the American people want. I mean, that's basically the gist of their conversation. But if I could just -- and I don't know if you guys are aware of this, but in 2014, I won a Slammy in the WWE for dancer of the year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I did not know.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: We have a floor. Hello?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It was the whole -- no, I'm retired from dancing. But here's the thing, that type of dancing is very popular with a certain sect in our community, a cultural group, my six-year-old daughter and her friends and my nine-year-old, they all dance and clean around the house and one -- and do moves and I have to like carry on like I've done many interviews, while I have dancing in the background while they're doing moves.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And they're showing their stuff. They even tried to say, "Dad were dance fighting," and I sent them to their rooms because I'm not -- there is no such thing as dance fighting. Because it doesn't really happen. You can do all the pop, locks and flip. It's a punch. But that's the world we live in now, its fantasy world for little kids times, because dancing makes it all better. If you watch any new kid show, it was like there's this big issue between the pony and the unicorn, but somehow --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's solved?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Solve with a dance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, it's just like "West Side Story."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I solve everything by dancing, Pete.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That's smart. I've seen "Stepbrothers." I see a microphone. I see a singer, I see a drum set. I see a drummer, I see a Slammy winter and I see a dance floor right here.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And I think Tyrus, now, is your time.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, but all you need to see is seven figures, and I am in it.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Bring New York City back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right. All right. I'm still -- the take home message here is that de Blasio is factually worse than Cuomo. But Cuomo has made a national debacle.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It is bad that we're here in New York saying, yes, well, this one is -- they are both really awful.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But that guy ran for President and he is destroying the city, but we're so focused on Cuomo because of what he's done. It's like -- it is not fair.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Two bad things should have happened separately. I don't even know if that makes sense.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: It doesn't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It doesn't. Up next, we unveil our first heroes in media.

utterances.speaker: ASHLEY STROHMIER, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Ashley Strohmier. A terrifying close call for a Colorado suburb after a Hawaii-bound United Airlines flight experienced engine failure. The plane scattered debris including large metal parts across several neighborhoods in Broomfield. It landed safely at Denver International Airport. No injuries were reported, but some property damage was happening and anyone finding debris from the plane is advised not to move it or touch it. Federal investigators are on the scene. Also three people are dead and two others are hurt after a shooting at a New Orleans area gun store. Investigators said gunfire erupted after an argument between the suspect and an employee. The suspect who died at the scene reportedly entered the store with a fully loaded un-holstered gun. The two injured people were taken to the hospital and are stable. I'm Ashley Strohmier. Now back to THE GREG GUTFELD SHOW. For all your headlines log on to foxnews.com.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: In a profession full of zeros, it's time to note the heroes in a new segment we're calling --

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Heroes in media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Our first hero, MSNBC's Joe Scarborough on the left there, slamming the idiots on cable news channels for comparing the destruction at the Capitol in January to the destruction from riots over the summer.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.utterance: Because I know there are idiots on other cable news channels that will say, well, you know, this mom and pop store was vandalized during the summer riots and that's just as bad as the United States Capitol being vandalized. No, no, actually, no. No, jackass, it's not. I'm not going to confuse a taco stand with the United States Capitol. I'm not going to confuse the selling of tacos with actually moving through a constitutional process.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The selling of tacos. What a tomato face turd whistle. The truth is, of course, the riots resulted in more than 20 deaths, as well as property damage estimated into the billions making it the most expensive period of unrest in our nation's recorded history. That's some taco stand, you sunbaked whitehead. I think I could speak for Planet Earth when I say [bleep] you Joe Scarborough. Our runner up, Nicolle Wallace moaning in delight over a Trump casino implosion.

utterances.speaker: NICOLLE WALLACE, MSNBC HOST
utterances.utterance: And I feel a little -- well, I don't feel bad playing it. Let me play this. This is the implosion of a Trump property. There it goes. Set a metaphor, Tim, are we done? This is Trump -- this is Trump and we've already ushered in -- are we done? Is it imploding?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I am just bathing in this for a second, Nicolle. Just let me enjoy it.

utterances.speaker: WALLACE
utterances.utterance: Right. Can we play it again? I never -- I never say stuff like this, but control room, can we play it again?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Play it again. Control room, play it again. It's weird how she claims she is so over someone, yet, she still can't let go. Reminds me of when I got dumped in high school. Oh, I'm so over her I'd say while poking pins in the voodoo doll I made from cat hair and her discarded clothing. And that's our --

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Heroes in media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Carley, if you or me dismiss the suffering of minority businesses as a taco stand, we would have our --

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: We are racists.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, we would be -- and also, we'd be on the streets, we'd be out.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
